alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:59PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Floyd and west central Jefferson Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Louisville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Audubon Park and Strathmoor Village around 405 PM EDT. Watterson Park, Strathmoor Manor and Newburg around 410 PM EDT. West Buechel, Lynnview, Poplar Hills, Buechel and Valley Station around 415 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Okolona and Fairdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
